column4: alright, anyone else have any insight to the following message: http://paste.ubuntu.com/41423/
can you add 'mount' to the aptitude install line?
probably, you're thinking apt-get install nfs-common mount?
my concern is why would mount, initscripts and system-services have to be removed?
wait, why are we talking in #ubuntu
this box was built from ubuntu server 8.04
oh, well. you're in unsupported land. if you want to use debian, install debian.
but that explains how you're hitting such problems
so you're telling me that out of the box, ubuntu server is pulling down from the debian repos and I get left in the dark because of it...hmmm
if ubuntu server does that it should be an epic bug
I haven't manually changed that sources list
hmmm. dunno. how about using debian :>
as much as I'd love to tear down and rebuild this box, the time is not available
